channel.title: When you grow up.. [ Babies or No? ]
channel.description:
No, i'm not going to bother making a poll. It's going to be discussing it.
When your older, and get married or currently are married. Will you choose to have babies? I, coming from Australia doubt i will for a few reasons.
> The drought in Australia seems to be getting worse and worse, and kids growing up in it would find it a struggle.
> The factors of global warming seem to be in a bit of trouble, i mean we're now having "Earth Hour" to attempt to eeze (sp) the global warming. ( though i doubt it will do much)
> Chinese taking over the world in the near future.
Post your thoughts, Yes/No + reason.

I want to give it all I have at becoming the best at racing, then have kids.

ill probly get married when im 28 then have kids at 30 so when there all 10 ill only be 40. but i also dont wantto have children because it hurts alot. its easy for guys to say they want kids because they dont have to give birth to them. anyways yeah ill probly have kids because thats the purpose of living is to pass on the name, and in every child a little bit of there parents live on. so in a way we all live on for ever.

@Cheesehunk wrote:

item.title: When you grow up.. [ Babies or No? ]
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:78342”][quote author=Hex Key link=topic=115023.msg1141025#msg1141025 date=1176356474]

I guess that is the question everyone asks: “What is the meaning of life?” I think we are here to make the world a better place for ourselves and our children, and of course to make children. What else? I don’t know, I’m sure there are plenty of other things as well.

But by making children you will averagly lower the quality of other childrens lives in the long run, paradox pls?
[/quote]

But according to evolution the better children will survive and reproduce, therefore improving the population. :)[/quote]
According to everything that modern genetics tells us, the opposite is true.

Read full topic

@rjop455 wrote:

I’m having 12 kids. That’s right 12. Global warming is a load of bull. We can filter water from the ocean which is the least of the problems. Why do you think the Chinese are taking over? Not having kids won’t solve it; it will just make that worse.

Just my opinion

item.title: When you grow up.. [ Babies or No? ]
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Me and susie both decided were gonna have one kid when we are 28 and call it either ash(boy) or lily(girl) But you can never know that, that will happen, because you never know when the condom might split or have an accident, its just what we plan and both dream of together.

Also yeah having it when im 28. i suggest other people take a lesson and understand that its better to have a kid in the late 20’s or even early 30’s because if you have it to early you will lose out on some other fun stuff. Also i suggest for everyone who is against children (because of the whole cruelness of bring them into the world that if you are afraid of that… just have one child because then you arent attributing to over populating - if you get what i mean.

my 2 cents.

Read full topic
